newsitem.title: CANADA: Canadian dollar opens flat in light trading.
newsitem.headline: Canadian dollar opens flat in light trading.

text.p: * Canada's dollar opened flat on Friday at C$1.3873
(US$0.7208) in light trading after the currency was sidelined in overnight trading, dealers said.
* They said a lack of economic data out of Canada and the United States would likely confine the currency to a narrow range of C$1.3860 (US$0.7211) and C$1.3890 (US$0.7199).
On Thursday, an expected Canada dollar sell-off on the back of disappointing economic data showing Canada's trade surplus shrinking from the previous month failed to materialize.
Instead, the currency gained back some of the losses
sustained this week, rallying to C$1.3875 (US$0.7207) before

The comeback followed a disastrous trading session on Wednesday when the Canadian dollar sunk to C$1.3930 (US$0.7176) after breaking through weak technical support, which triggered a spate of stop-loss orders.
"The only thing we can say is that this has been a disappointing week for the Canadian dollar," Farrill said.
"There hasn't been anything numberwise to suggest why we should be selling Canadian dollars, yet we're substantially lower than where we were last week," Farrill added.
On the crosses, the Canadian dollar rose to 82.54 yen from Thursday's 82.20 yen and jumped to 1.2441 marks from Thursday's 1.2422 marks.
